components.note: Schedule Page - Slip Chart & Risk Erosion

element.message:
Lost Time Incident Rate (TRIR) and Total Recordable Injury Rate (TRIR) are calculated for each period end date by dividing respective Incidents or Recordable Injuries by total Office & Construction hours worked.

Accidents are classified into the following categories:
  • First Aid: an accident requiring first aid
  • Medical (Beyond First Aid): an accident requiring the management and care of a patient to combat a disease or disorder
  • Near Miss: an accident in which no property was damaged and no personal injury was sustained, but where, given a slight shift in time or position, damage or injury easily could have occurred
  • Fatal: an accident resulting in death

name.title: Program Incident Rates by Period
name.subtitle: LTIR, TRIR, and Total Hours Worked

element.message: Performance Over Time chart displays a typical S-curve for the program with period values for each project. Series data in the chart can be toggled on/off using the legend.

name.title: Incidents

element.message:
An injury is any wound or damage to the body resulting from an event in the work environment, e.g. cut, insect bite, muscle strain.

Illnesses are classified into the following categories:
  • Skin diseases or disorders
  • Respiratory conditions
  • Poisoning
  • Hearing loss
  • All other illnesses
